title_trans: Prakaran 151: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી પરચા વર્ણવી કહું કાનમ દેશના કાંય 
ધન્ય ધન્ય એહ ભક્તને જેની શ્રી હરિએ કરી સાય
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The speaker describes their devotion to God, saying they will describe it without embellishment and compare it to the great nation's treasury. They thank God for granting them such devotion.

gujarati.couplet:
એક ઉતરાદ ગામમાં કહીએ કણબી સાકરબાઈ 
હરિજન અતિ હેત હૈયે પ્રીત્ય ઘણી પ્રભુ માંઇ
gujarati.context: In a small village, Sakarbai is known for her kindness; she has the Lord's blessings in abundance, with many people being fond of her.

gujarati.couplet:
તેના દેહનો આવિયો વળી અવધિ પોત્યે અંત 
ચ્યાર દિવસ મોરથી આવ્યા પોત્યે ભગવંત
gujarati.context: His physical body has perished, but the time of his departure is yet to come; On the appointed day, he will return to God, the Supreme Being.

gujarati.couplet:
આવી કહ્યું એહ બાઈને તું કર્ય હરિનું ભજન 
આજ થકી દન ચારમાં છૂટશે તારું તન
gujarati.context: I was told to come and sing praises of Hari; today I will get free from the cycle of birth and death.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી માની વાલાનું વચન બાઈ બેઠી કરવા ભજન 
સમરે સ્વામીને શ્વાસઉશ્વાસ થઈ જક્ત સુખથી ઉદાસ
gujarati.context: The couplet says that after accepting one's fate, one should sit and chant prayers; the heart beats with joy as it breathes in and out, feeling peaceful and carefree.

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરતાં વીત્યા દન ચાર આવ્યા તેડવા પ્રાણઆધાર 
એની ભત્રીજી નામ કેશર્ય આવ્યા ઘનશ્યામ તેને ઘેર
gujarati.context: They lived for a short time, relying on their loved ones; Keshri's name was Bhattriji and Ghanshyam surrounded her with love.

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યા પોત્યે પ્રકટ પ્રમાણ સુખસાગર શ્યામ સુજાણ 
દીધાં બહુ જનને દર્શન નીર્ખી બાઈ થઈ છે મગન
gujarati.context: The joys of life are revealed only when one is ready and has achieved spiritual understanding, just like the peaceful Shyam Sujaan lake. Many people fail to realize this truth, even after seeing it with their own eyes.

gujarati.couplet:
કહે ધન્ય ધન્ય મારા નાથ આજ અમને કર્યાં સનાથ 
ઘણે દાડે પધાર્યા છો ઘેર મુજ રંક પર કરી મહેર
gujarati.context: Today, I have been blessed with good fortune, my dear friend; our joys are overflowing like a palace on our forehead.

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહીને આપ્યાં આસન કર્યાં ભાત્ય ભાત્યનાં ભોજન 
પછી નાથ જમ્યા તેને ઘેર કરી મનમોહનજીએ મહેર
gujarati.context:
Here is a summarization of the couplet in English:

We have received this world as our seat, and we have earned the feast of worldly pleasures; after that, it was not possible to escape the grasp of desires, and Manmohanji made us the sovereign.

gujarati.couplet:
જમી ઊઠ્યા આપ્યો મુખવાસ પછી હાથ જોડી કહે દાસ 
આજ આવ્યાનું કારણ કહીયે સુણી બોલ્યા સ્વામીજી તૈયે
gujarati.context: The speaker is humbly attributing their good fortune to God's will, with hands joined in gratitude. The reason for their current prosperity is attributed to the blessings of their lord and master.

gujarati.couplet:
તારી કાકી સાકરબાઈ નામે તેને તેડી જાશું નિજ ધામે 
આવ્યા એ સારુ બેસીને વાજિ તેડી જાતાં તું રાજી કુરાજી
gujarati.context: I will tie my aunt Sakkubai with a rope at my own place; she has come to stay, and I am ready to bear the consequences of her tantrums.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બોલી છે કેશરબાઈ એહ જીવની ધન્ય કમાઈ 
જેને તેડવા આવ્યા છો તમે શીદને કુરાજી થાયે અમે

એવું સાંભળી બોલ્યા મહારાજ નહિ તેડી જાયે એને આજ 
પણ ચાર દન મોર્ય આવી એને તેડ્યાનું ગ્યાતા ઠરાવી
gujarati.context: A wise king once said that something will not happen today, but even after four days, the outcome became certain. Despite initial doubts, reality soon unfolded.

gujarati.couplet:
તેને કહેજ્યે તું જઈ વચન કૈયે નહિ છૂટે તારું તન 
એમ કહી પધાર્યા મહારાજ કરી અલૌકિ એટલું કાજ
gujarati.context:
When destiny calls, you must go; your soul cannot escape from its fate.

This is the path I have been taught by my king, and it has led me to achieve something extraordinary.

gujarati.couplet:
વળી વાત કહું એક સારી હરિજન લેજ્યો હૈયે ધારી 
કાનમ દેશમાં કેલોદ ગામ તિયાં શેખ વલિભાઈ નામ
gujarati.context: I'll tell a good story once, and the Harijan will take it as their oath; in Kanam's country, there is the village of Kelod, where Shaikh Valibhai resides.

gujarati.couplet:
સાચા સંતની વાત સાંભળી ગઈ અસત્ય આસતા ટળી 
સાચા જાણ્યા સદગુરુ સ્વામી બીજા જણાણા ખરા હરામી
gujarati.context: Listen to the words of true saints and ignore false ones; recognize your true guru, and others are just mere pretenders.

gujarati.couplet:
પીર ફકીર મલાં મલંગ તેને તજી કર્યો સતસંગ 
પછી સહુએ કર્યો એ વિચાર કર્યા વલિભાઈ નાત્ય બાર
gujarati.context: The pious and the poor are united in their spiritual journey, and after that, they ponder over the mysteries of life; their thoughts are filled with devotion and prayer.

gujarati.couplet:
તેને વીતી ગયાં વર્ષ ચાર નહિ વલિને સંશય લગાર 
ભલો ભક્ત જક્ત નહિ જેને સ્વામી વિના માને નહિ કેને
gujarati.context: Four years have passed since he left, yet no doubts arise; Only a true devotee can remain unwavering without their Lord.

gujarati.couplet:
ભજે પ્રભુ પ્રકટ પ્રમાણ સહુ ઉપર રહી સુજાણ 
એમ કરતાં હરિભજન તેને વીતી ગયા બહુ દન
gujarati.context: The devotee worships the Lord with complete sincerity, staying above worldly pleasures; by doing so, they have left their worldly desires behind for a long time.

gujarati.couplet:
પહોતી અવધિ દેહની જ્યારે આવ્યા તેડવા મહારાજ ત્યારે 
લાવ્યા રથ વેલ્ય ને વિમાન આપે અશ્વે બેસી ભગવાન
gujarati.context: When the body is worn out by time's passage, Maharaja arrives then; He makes the chariot of life ride on air and God settles in as his horse.

gujarati.couplet:
આવી વાડીમાં ઊતર્યા નાથ બહુ સખા છે પોતાને સાથ 
દીઠું વાડીવાળે તે પ્રસિદ્ધ રથ વેલ્ય વિમાન બહુવિદ્ધ
gujarati.context: A true friend is hard to find in one's own community, but when found, they are worth more than any famous person. Their guidance and wisdom are like a chariot taking you to great heights.

gujarati.couplet:
ઘણાં ઘોડાં બળદ અપાર બોલ્યો રખવાળો તેહવાર 
મારી ખેતી આ જાશે ખવાઈ અમારે છે આટલી જીવાઈ
gujarati.context: Many people may be wealthy and prosperous, but it's the one who toils hard that truly enjoys their labor; my farming will yield a good harvest, we've lived for as much as we can.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે બોલિયા દીનદયાળ ચિંતા મ કર્ય તું રખવાળ 
આ બળદ ને ઘોડાં અમારાં તારી ખેતીનાં નહિ ખાનારાં
gujarati.context: When I'm sorrowful and anxious, keep your worries for yourself; my troubles are not like the crops you harvest, which others don't eat.

gujarati.couplet:
અમે આવ્યા છીએ આંહીં આજ વલીભાઈને તેડવા કાજ 
એમ એને કહી અવિનાશ પછી આવ્યા વલીભાઈ પાસ
gujarati.context: We have arrived here today, with the intention to fulfill Valibhai's request; and so, we will convey this message to him unbroken and then return.

gujarati.couplet:
થયાં વલિભાઈને દર્શન લાગ્યો પાય કહે ધન્ય ધન્ય 
મારે હતો ભરુંસો તમારો જાણું જરૂર નહિ વિસારો
gujarati.context: After seeing the beauty of Vilibhai, I felt grateful and blessed; my wealth was your love, not something to be traded or sold.

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે નાથ કહે અમે આજ આવ્યા તમને તેડવા કાજ 
એવું સુણ્યું વાલાનું વચન ચાલ્યા વલિભાઈ તજી તન
gujarati.context:
When the time is right, I'll tell you today, my decision to leave is already made; 
Such a promise was given by the wind, and now it's being fulfilled in vain.

gujarati.couplet:
દીઠા સતસંગી કુસંગી સહુએ માન્યું આશ્ચર્ય મનમાં બહુએ 
કહે ધન્ય ધન્ય સતસંગ જીતી ગયા વલિભાઈ જંગ
gujarati.context: In the company of good people, one's mind is filled with wonder and surprise; noble friends are a victory that brings fame and glory.

gujarati.couplet:
થયો પરચો પ્રકટ પ્રમાણ નહિ માને મૂરખ અજાણ 
એમ કહી રહ્યાં નરનારી જોઈ સામર્થિ સ્વામીની ભારી
gujarati.context: One who doesn't recognize their own worth and values others' opinions is foolish; only when you realize your own strength, can you bear the burden of your partner's expectations.

gujarati.couplet:
વળી સુરત શહેરની વાત કહું સહુ સાંભળો વિખ્યાત 
તિયાં રહે બહુ હરિજન કરે સ્વામીશ્રીજીનું ભજન
gujarati.context: The city of Surat's famous story is that many Harijans, despite their hardships, sincerely worship the Lord Swaminarayan.

gujarati.couplet:
પૂરે પરચા નિત્ય પ્રત્યે નાથ તેણે મગન રહે સહુ સાથ 
એવું સમજે નહિ કોઈ જન પ્રભુ આવ્યા વિના છૂટે તન
gujarati.context: The one who has experienced the bliss of being with God every moment, can never be separated from Him; only a foolish person does not understand this.

gujarati.couplet:
રથ વેલ્ય વાજિ ને વિમાન લાવે અંતસમે ભગવાન 
આવે તેડવા જનને નાથ માગી શીખ જાય હરિ સાથ
gujarati.context: The soul is like a chariot that takes the ride of life to reach heaven; it's guided by God and doesn't need anything else.

gujarati.couplet:
એવો સહુને મને વિશવાસ તન તજી જાશું પ્રભુ પાસ 
પણ એક વાત છે નવીન કહું સાંભળો જન પ્રવીન
gujarati.context: I will trust in the one who has faith in me, and I will go to God's mercy; but there is a new thing that I must tell you all.

gujarati.couplet:
એક પારશી અરદેશરજી તેને સતસંગની રીત્ય રજી 
સાચા જાણ્યા સહજાનંદ સ્વામી બીજા જણાણા લોભી હરામી
gujarati.context: One who has self-discipline and is mindful of good company will be blessed with true joy, while others may crave it but never attain it.

gujarati.couplet:
જોયા જોગી જંગમ સંન્યાસી તપી ત્યાગી વૈરાગી ઉદાસી 
પીર ફકીર મલાં મલંગી દીઠાં શેખ ભેખ બહુરંગી
gujarati.context: One who has renounced worldly desires and material possessions is a true ascetic, abandoning all attachments and desires. The pir (spiritual guide) and fakir (ascetic) are one in the same, with a simple attire and a great understanding of spiritual matters.

gujarati.couplet:
કણ વણ રહ્યા કુકશા ગ્રહી એવા દીઠા જગતમાં કહી 
જોઈ લીધું સર્વનું તે સાર જાણ્યા ભૂલેલ ભૂમિનો ભાર
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

Life's journey is like a fleeting dream, spoken words leave a lasting impression. True wealth lies in understanding what we've learned and shouldering the responsibility that comes with it.

gujarati.couplet:
જ્યારે સાંભળી સ્વામીની વાત ત્યારે મનમાં પામ્યો નિરાંત 
પછી અતિશે વિશ્વાસ આવ્યો તેડી સ્વામીને શહેરમાં લાવ્યો
gujarati.context: When listening to my beloved's words, I felt a deep peace in my mind; afterwards, faith increased so much that I brought her to the city.

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ આદરે પધરાવ્યા નાથ હતા મુનિ પંચશત સાથ 
કરી પૂજા ઘેરે પધરાવી સારી સેવા કરી મન ભાવી
gujarati.context: A person's good deeds and worship are appreciated by others, but it's the inner intention and devotion that truly matters. Only a true saint (munis) with a pure heart can understand this.

gujarati.couplet:
લીધો લોચન ભરીને લાઓ જાણ્યું આવો નાવે ફરી દાઓ 
તિયાં નાથ રહ્યા નવ દન દીધાં બહુ જીવને દર્શન
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

Satisfy your longings with patience, and then take a new journey; many lives have been seen through such experiences.

gujarati.couplet:
કરી અનેક જનનાં કાજ ત્યાંથી પાછા પધાર્યા મહારાજ 
તેને વીતી ગયા બહુ દન થયું અરદેશરને સ્વપ્ન
gujarati.context: Many people's struggles have led to the great king's downfall; he has been forgotten in a distant land, a mere dream in exile.

gujarati.couplet:
દીઠા સહજાનંદ સુખકારી અતિ તેજોમય મૂર્તિ ભારી 
લાગ્યો લળી લળી વળી પાય નીર્ખી નયણાં તૃપ્ત ન થાય
gujarati.context: The joy of simple happiness is immense, a divine bliss that lifts the soul; but even with all its beauty, it's still not enough to satisfy one's deep desires.

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નાથ કુંકુમ લઈ લાલ કર્યો ચંદ્ર અરદેશર ભાલ 
કહ્યું સવારે તને રાજન દેશે મોટ્ય માનજ્યે મન
gujarati.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

After all, love has taken me away, just like the moon; I have given my life to you, and my country is now a mere memory.

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કહી પધાર્યા દયાળ જાગ્યો અરદેશર તતકાળ 
લઈ દર્પણ ને મુખ દેખ્યું દીઠો ચાંદલો આશ્ચર્ય લેખ્યું
gujarati.context:
Here is a summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The moment I looked at my reflection, I was startled to see my own pride and vanity staring back at me.

gujarati.couplet:
થયું કહ્યું હતું તે મહારાજે આપી શહેર સુબાગરી રાજે 
જે જે કહીતી સ્વપને વાત તે તો સવારે થઈ સાક્ષાત્
gujarati.context: The king himself once told me what was to be mine; now I have achieved it in the morning, exactly as he said.

gujarati.couplet:
પામ્યો પરચો આશ્ચર્ય લેખ્યો ભાલમાં ચંદ્ર પ્રકટ દેખ્યો 
એવાં એવાં આ સમે મહારાજ કરે છે જનનાં બહુ કાજ
gujarati.context:
I have witnessed the wonder of being surprised and seen the moon's radiant glow in a well; 
The great king, Maharaja, is doing many good deeds for humanity.

gujarati.couplet:
વળી ભક્ત એક ભગુ નામ તેને જાણે તે સઘળું ગામ 
લિયે પારકી વઢવેડ્ય વેચાતી કરે નિત્ય કમાણી તેમાંથી
gujarati.context: The devotee knows God's name as the one and only, all worldly affairs are revealed to them; they earn daily by dedicating themselves to their spiritual pursuit.

gujarati.couplet:
કહે સહુ છે કજિયાદાર મુવા પછી જાશે જમદ્વાર 
પણ ભગુને ભરોસો ભારી નાથ નહિ જુવે કરણી મારી
gujarati.context: A person's pride and ego (kajiyadhar) will be destroyed after they die, but if you have the trust of God (Bhagun), you won't have to worry about your soul's fate.

gujarati.couplet:
લોભી લંપટી છું હું હરામી પણ નહિ તજે મુજને સ્વામી 
એવો ખરો વિશ્વાસ તે દલે ન ભજે બીજાને કોઈ પળે
gujarati.context: I am a greedy and foolish person, but I don't think anyone else is worthy to be my God; this kind of faith is false, and no one can worship anyone else at any time.

gujarati.couplet:
એમ વીતી ગયા બહુ દન આવી અવધિ તજિયું તન 
આવ્યા તેડવા પોત્યે મહારાજ લાવ્યા રથ એક ભગુ કાજ
gujarati.context: Many days have passed since then; time has wiped out the past. They arrived at my place, Maharaja, and brought back a single thing: their kingdom.

gujarati.couplet:
તેણે હસ્તિ જુત્યા જન જોઈ પામ્યા આશ્ચર્ય તે સહુ કોઈ 
કહે માંહોમાંહિ એમ મળી આવી વાત ન દીઠી સાંભળી
gujarati.context: Someone's hand was unexpectedly touched, leaving them surprised and wondering; it's as if a secret conversation unfolded without being spoken.

gujarati.couplet:
હસ્તિ રથ દીઠો દ્રગે આજ ચાલ્યા ભગુને તેડી મહારાજ 
હુવાં દર્શન જન બહુને થયા પરચા જણાણું સહુને
gujarati.context: Today's journey was like a chariot ride, guided by the royal advisor; we've met many people and shared our experiences with friends.

gujarati.couplet:
એવા એ શહેર માંહિ અનેક થાય પરચા ન લખાય છેક 
સર્વે લખતાં ન આવે પાર કહે નિષ્કુળાનંદ નિરધાર
gujarati.context: In such a city, many things happen, but nothing is written down; only the foolish and simple-minded make predictions.

transliteration.couplet:

Dhanya dhanya eh bhaktane, jenī Shrī Harie karī sāy.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: A soulful devotee is one who has surrendered to the Lord, abandoning all worldly desires. Their true wealth lies in their devotion to God.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek Utarād gāmmā, kahīe kaṇabī Sākarbāī; <RHYME_2>
Harijan ati het haiye, prītya ghaṇī Prabhu māi.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: A simple-minded person from a village, Sākarbāī, is loved by God; The Harijans' love for God is true and deep.

transliteration.couplet:
Tenā dehno āviyo, vaḷī avadhi potye ant; <RHYME_3>
Chyār divas morathī, āvyā potye Bhagwant.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: The soul has come to the body, and time is short; one should seek God's blessings before death arrives.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvī kahyu eh bāīne, tu karya Harinu bhajan; <RHYME_4>
Āj thakī dan chārmā, chhūṭashe tāru tan.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: One must surrender to God and perform devotional services; when exhausted, rest in the shade of a tree.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī mānī vālānu vachan, bāī beṭhī karavā bhajan; <RHYME_5>
Samare Swāmīne shvās-ushvās, thaī jakta sukhthī udās.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of a devotee's yearning to hear the divine words, and in response, they experience a sense of joy and inner peace. The devotee's soul is filled with happiness as they take slow breaths and surrender to the Lord.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karatā vītyā dan chār, āvyā teḍavā prāṇ-ādhār; <RHYME_6>
Enī bhatrījī nām Kesharya, āvyā Ghanshyām tene gher.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: This Gujarati couplet describes a person's life as fleeting and precious, like a flame that burns out soon, with the only anchor being the breath of life.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyā potye prakaṭ pramāṇ, sukh-sāgar Shyām sujāṇ; <RHYME_7>
Dīdhā bahu janane darshan, nīrkhī bāī thaī chhe magan.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy and beauty of a loving relationship, where happiness and togetherness are evident, like a deep ocean (Sukh-sagar). The speaker longs for a glimpse (darshan) of their beloved in this world.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe dhanya dhanya mārā Nāth, āj amane karyā sanāth; <RHYME_8>
Ghaṇe dāḍe padhāryā chho gher, muj rank par karī maher.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: The couplet is about being grateful for one's blessings and acknowledging God's role in life. It highlights the importance of humility and recognizing one's place in the world.

transliteration.couplet:
Em kahīne āpyā āsan, karyā bhātya bhātyanā bhojan; <RHYME_9>
Pachhī Nāth jamyā tene gher, karī man-mohanjīe maher.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: Even in simplicity and humility, one can enjoy a meal with friends; at another's place, there is no end to the joy of being welcomed.

transliteration.couplet:
Jamī ūṭhyā āpyo mukhvās, pachhī hāth joḍī kahe dās; <RHYME_10>
Āj āvyānu kāraṇ kahīye, suṇī bolyā Swāmījī taiye.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: A person's wealth is not measured by the amount of land they own, but rather by their devotion to their master. One should focus on pleasing God, not accumulating material possessions.

transliteration.couplet:
Tārī kākī Sākarbāī nāme, tene teḍī jāshu nij dhāme; <RHYME_11>
Āvyā e sāru besīne vāji, teḍī jātā tu rājī kurājī.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization:

Sakarbai, known as Kakki, has her own home and does not disturb others; she herself settles in her own way without bothering anyone else. She makes peace with others and stays peaceful, never disturbing the calm around her.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre bolī chhe Kesharbāī, eh jīvnī dhanya kamāī; <RHYME_12>
Jene teḍavā āvyā chho tame, shīdane kurājī thāye ame.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: Kesharbāī's words are like a blessing, making life's struggles a little easier; her presence brings us comfort and solace in times of turmoil.

transliteration.couplet:
Evu sāmbhaḷī bolyā Mahārāj, nahi teḍī jāye ene āj; <RHYME_13>
Paṇ chār dan morya āvī, ene teḍyānu gyātā ṭharāvī.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context:
The Maharaj has not gone anywhere today; 
Four arms of charity are sufficient to guide me.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene kahejye tu jaī vachan, kaiye nahi chhūṭe tāru tan; <RHYME_14>
Em kahī padhāryā Mahārāj, karī alauki eṭalu kāj.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: The couplet says that a person's words can be fleeting like the wind, but their actions leave a lasting impact, like a tree's branches that don't let go. A wise leader knows this and prioritizes meaningful work over mere chatter.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī vāt kahu ek sārī, harijan lejyo haiye dhārī; <RHYME_15>
Kānam deshmā Kelod gām, tiyā shekh Valibhāī nām.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: A strong gust of wind can sweep away a person's entire life, just like the Harijan community is being forcibly removed from its ancestral land. The village they are leaving behind is called Kelod and it belongs to Valibhāī by name.

transliteration.couplet:
Sāchā santnī vāt sāmbhaḷī, gaī asatya āsatā ṭaḷī; <RHYME_16>
Sāchā jāṇyā sadguru Swāmī, bījā jaṇāṇā kharā harāmī.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: A truthful person's words have a soothing effect like gentle breeze, while false words bring chaos and destruction. A true guru teaches the seed of spiritual growth, which blossoms into freedom from worldly attachments.

transliteration.couplet:
Pīr fakīr malā malang, tene tajī karyo satasang; <RHYME_17>
Pachhī sahue karyo e vichār, karyā Valibhāī nātya bār.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: A saintly soul, a seeker of truth, and a crazy one come together to have a sacred gathering. Later, they get lost in thought, and the Vali-Bhai's drama unfolds.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene vītī gayā varṣh chār, nahi valine sanshay lagār; <RHYME_18>
Bhalo bhakta jakta nahi jene, Swāmī vinā māne nahi kene.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: A year passes like a chariot's wheel, without any regret or anxiety. A true devotee doesn't grieve, as they don't exist without the Lord's presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhaje Prabhu prakaṭ pramāṇ, sahu upar rahī sujāṇ; <RHYME_19>
Em karatā haribhajan, tene vītī gayā bahu dan.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: The Lord reveals His greatness and is pleased with those who are devoted to Him, residing above the mundane world. Through His devotion, He bestows numerous blessings on those who worship Him with love and sincerity.

transliteration.couplet:

Lāvyā rath velya ne vimān, āpe ashve besī Bhagwān.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a devotee who has gained spiritual insight and is blessed by the divine, with their chariot (life) moving swiftly towards liberation. Their horse (mind) is guided by God's will, ensuring their journey is prosperous and successful.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The lord of the house is well-known for his great deeds done in partnership with many friends; His chariot is famous, having various vehicles for different purposes.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A pair of doves builds a home with great effort and toil, just as we work hard for our own family's well-being. Just as the dove's nest is their everything, similarly, our family is our very life.

transliteration.couplet:

Ā baḷad ne ghoḍā amārā, tārī khetīnā nahi khānārā.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: The speaker's words are like a gift to the listener, so keep them in mind; Like my farm, others may cultivate it, but I won't let anyone harvest its fruit.

transliteration.couplet:

Em ene kahī Avināsh, pachhī āvyā Valībhāī pās.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: Today's worries are nothing, just a dance to be done; Tomorrow's troubles will come to you at someone else's doorsteps.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A parent's meeting with their child is a blessed occasion, worthy of gratitude and joy. When the child grows up, they will definitely not forget their upbringing.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre Nāth kahe ame āj, āvyā tamane teḍavā kāj; <RHYME_26>

transliteration.context: The couplet describes a father asking his son to do the chores today and warning him that if he doesn't comply, their elder brother Vali will get upset. The son is cautioned to listen to his mother's words and not disobey her.

transliteration.couplet:
Dīṭhā satasangī kusangī sahue, mānyu āshcharya manmā bahue; <RHYME_27>
Kahe dhanya dhanya satasang, jītī gayā Valibhāī jang.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: In the presence of good company, one's humility and wonder grow, while one's ego shrinks; this is considered a blessing. This is what makes life a victory, like the valiant Valibhāī.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A person is considered foolish if they don't recognize their own limitations and overestimate themselves. One should stay in their place and not try to do more than what they are capable of, like a woman stays under her husband's protection.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī Surat shahernī vāt, kahu sahu sāmbhaḷo vikhyāt; <RHYME_29>
Tiyā rahe bahu harijan, kare Swāmī-Shrījīnu bhajan.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: In Surat, the winds of spirituality are famous, with many devotees singing praises to God and Lord Krishna. Despite being numerous, they remain humble and continue their devotion to the divine pair.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The divine Lord is always with us, like a constant companion to our family and children. He alone knows the true nature of everything, without which even the mighty would be nothing.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

The true guru Sahajanand Swami, the seed of love and desire, was attracted to his devotees with immense passion.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: When I am anxious about the future, my mind is filled with worries; but when I place my trust in you, my soul becomes free from all troubles.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The Lord is a gracious host who welcomes me, along with thousands of others, and honors my worship. Through love, I offer devotion to Him, seeking His presence in my heart.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that a person's life is filled with troubles (lochan) until they surrender to God and find peace; it also implies that those who follow the path of devotion will ultimately see the divine.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: This Gujarati couplet describes the Supreme Being as one who is effortlessly happy and brings joy to others, being a radiant and luminous form. The Lord's playfulness is so delightful that it can't be described or limited by words.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The king's words are sweet as nectar, ruling over the city like a lord; When I recall that moment in my life, it remains etched in my memory like a witness.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The wonders of the world are written in the sky, and even the full moon is visible to those who seek it. Even if a king has many tasks, he should still perform his spiritual duties.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A devotee knows only one God's name and recognizes the Lord's village; they live joyfully without worldly attachments and constantly yearn for Him.

transliteration.couplet:

True faith is needed to break free from worldly desires, just as a farmer tills the soil before planting a seed.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: There is no one like God's wisdom; it amazes even the wise.

Hasti rath dīṭho drage āj, chālyā Bhagune teḍī Mahārāj; <RHYME_50>
Huvā darshan jan bahune, thayā parachā jaṇāṇu sahune.  <RHYME_50>
transliteration.context: The devotee's soul is now in a hurry to meet God Maharaj, as they have obtained the vision of divine love; numerous people are eager to behold this sight, but only those with pure hearts can truly understand it.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā e shaher māhi anek, thāy parachā na lakhāy chhek; <RHYME_51>
Sarve lakhatā na āve pār, kahe Niṣhkuḷānand niradhār.  <RHYME_51>
transliteration.context:
This Gujarati couplet describes the beauty of a city (Evā e shaher) with its many wonders and attractions, but also cautions that one should not be blinded by it all.

It further advises to appreciate what is truly valuable (Sarve lakhatā na āve pār) in life.
